resources.string: Stylish, retro-chic nook, with inventive meals cooked in an open kitchen, plus fair-trade espresso.
Hip, airy joint with outdoor seats and exposed rafters, serving up boutique coffee and cafe staples.
Laid-back chain with stylish decor, doling out traditional Malaysian meals, drinks and desserts.
Coffee and an international menu in a light-filled, open-plan art deco building with outdoor tables.
Laid-back place with a seasonal brunch menu and parkland views, plus a courtyard and a deck.
Siam Paragon in Bangkok is one of the largest shopping malls in Thailand. Only the nearby CentralWorld is larger.
Located in Kuala Lumpur, Berjaya Times Square is a twin tower complex containing a shopping center and two five star hotels.
Located on the European side of Istanbul in Turkey, the Cevahir Shopping and Entertainment Centre opened its doors in 2005.
Opened in 1991, SM Megamall in Metro Manila is one of the largest malls in the Philippines. The mall attracts a daily foot traffic of 800,000 people.
New South China Mall in Dongguan, China, is the largest mall in the world based on gross leasable area.
Homemade pizza, pasta and gelato in a convivial spot with a separate bar and a garden courtyard.
Buzzy venue adorned with film and theatre memorabilia, offering a global menu, plus cabaret shows.
Laid-back chain with stylish decor, doling out traditional Malaysian meals, drinks and desserts.
Seasonal dishes, plus homemade bread, in an edgy setting with distressed walls and an open kitchen.
Spanish share plates and upscale wine served in an art deco dining hall with plush furniture.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest collection of coral reefs in the world, spanning over 1,400 miles.
As the only one of the Seven Ancient Wonders of the World still largely intact.
Lots of mystery surrounds Stonehenge, and contrary to those who believe it’s just a pile of 25-ton rocks.
Carved over thousands of years by the Colorado River, the Grand Canyon is a sight to behold.
Like Stonehenge, no one really knows the story behind the 887 Easter Island “moai” statues.
